d0deb41d-546e-4d60-9085-d72d8d570d58.description: The Consulting Certificate is delivered in partnership with Kairos Consulting Lab and is meant to provide participants with a broad skill set. Participants will gain an understanding of the consulting industry, strategic planning, operations management, business analytics, and business development.
d0deb41d-546e-4d60-9085-d72d8d570d58.name: Consulting Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

entity.name: Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

badge_template_activities.title: Earning the badge requires that participants attend all sessions and complete all assignments, including the assigned capstone projects.

240fbf91-1625-4296-86ee-7b38c25e0de3.description: Pepperdine University- Graduate School of Education and Psychology is committed to creating an environment of inclusivity through its Belonging initiatives. As part of those efforts, the school celebrated its first annual Latino Heritage Month. As part of our celebrations, we had a series of speakers who participated in our events and shared their respective journeys as Latinos within higher ed. GSEP is celebrating our speakers' stories and contributions to our journey of growth and development.
240fbf91-1625-4296-86ee-7b38c25e0de3.name: Latino Heritage Month Celebration Speaker Series

issuer.summary: issued by Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

entity.name: Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

badge_template_activities.title: This badge was issued to presenters that were part of the Latino Heritage Celebration at GSEP.

464cbd11-730f-4b7a-aace-10502c42d512.description: Pepperdine University’s Graduate School of Education & Psychology is committed to cultivating a community that supports the professional development and career advancement of our graduates. “Jamii,” a Swahili term for “community,” is designed to provide up-to-date insight on career trends in education and psychology, while building a professional network of students, alumni, and industry leaders. Our Jamii: Communities of Practice program includes a Fall #Jamii Career Webinar Series (moderated
464cbd11-730f-4b7a-aace-10502c42d512.name: Jamii: Communities of Practice

issuer.summary: issued by Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

entity.name: Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

badge_template_activities.title: This badge was issued to speakers that participated in Pepperdine GSEP’s Jamii: Communities of Practice programming.

33993cce-cb5b-4d1b-bda5-78fdcefef633.description: The Building Resilient Teams Certificate program focuses on understanding the fundamentals of team leadership, what it takes to build effective teams, and how having resilient teams can positively impact organizational outcomes. At the Trainer Level, you receive 21 hours of professional development credit. This certificate does not constitute the RBLP certification.
33993cce-cb5b-4d1b-bda5-78fdcefef633.name: Building Resilient Teams Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

entity.name: Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

badge_template_activities.title: Participants need to complete a 7-week course that will focus on a variety of aspects related to team building. Participants need to engage in weekly sessions, and review all readings & videos in preparation for the lessons. Additionally, GSEP is an ATP for the RBLP certifications; the certificate can serve as test prep for those certifications. This certificate does not constitute the RBLP certification.

skills.name: Develop A Positive Climate And Culture

818dc69d-45a3-4a0e-a0e5-2798a59ff546.description: Through this program, a select number of graduates of the Ph.D. program in Global Leadership and Change are selected to complete a one-year, part-time, paid, Postdoctoral Fellowship. During this year, the postdoctoral fellows will engage in teaching and research in partnership with the Education Division faculty. Fellows spend the year developing skills and research around a preferred topic in collaboration with a sponsoring faculty.
818dc69d-45a3-4a0e-a0e5-2798a59ff546.name: Pepperdine Excellence Postdoctoral Project for Equity Research (PEPPER)

issuer.summary: issued by Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

entity.name: Pepperdine University – Graduate School of Education and Psychology (GSEP)

badge_template_activities.title: Awardees must be graduates of the Ph.D. program in Global Leadership and Change and are vetted and selected through a formal committee process.

726d4f7a-45ad-4b2c-8341-0f8282537adf.description: Pepperdine University- Graduate School of Education and Psychology is committed to creating an environment of inclusivity through its Belonging initiatives. As part of those efforts, the school celebrated Black History Month with a series of speakers and panel presentations dealing with our hidden figures. GSEP is celebrating our speakers' stories and contributions to our journey of growth and development.
726d4f7a-45ad-4b2c-8341-0f8282537adf.name: Black History Month Speaker Series
